title: Census of Population and Housing 2024 report presented to President
byline: The report on the ’Census of Population and Housing 2024,’ conducted by the Census and Statistics Department was officially handed over to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (07) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Parliament informs Election Commission of vacant seat
byline: Parliament has officially informed the Election Commission that a Parliamentary seat has fallen vacant with the demise of NPP Kegalle District MP Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera who passed away yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes over 700,000 tourists in first quarter of 2025
byline: A total of 722,276 tourist arrivals were recorded during the first three months of 2025, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been further remanded until April 21 by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court.

title: Man arrested with sea cow flesh in Mannar
byline: A man was arrested by wildlife officers from the Vavuniya Wildlife Zone and the Mannar site for possessing one kilogram of sea cow (Dugong dugon) flesh.

title: Anuradhapura airbase designated as Int’l airport for a day
byline: The Anuradhapura airbase was declared an international airport effective for one day to facilitate the departure of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a separate aircraft to Rameswaram in the southern part of India yesterday.

title: Economy shows steady progress: CBSL Governor informs President
byline: Presenting the Annual Economic Review for 2024 (AER 2024) to President and Minister of Finance, Anura Kumara Disanayake, Governor of the Central Bank Dr. P. Nandalal Weerasinghe highlighted the steady progress of Sri Lanka’s economic recovery following the country’s most severe downturn in recent history.

title: MDMK leader Vaiko condemns India-Sri Lanka defence MoU
byline: Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK) General Secretary Vaiko condemned the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between India and Sri Lanka for defence cooperation during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to the neighbouring island nation.

title: Namal leaves CID
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa who arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), left the premises a short while ago after recording a statement .

title: Sri Lanka braces for intense heat, heavy rains
byline: While several parts of the island are expected to experience heavy rainfall above100 mm, the sun is also currently passing directly overhead in several areas.

title: Customs thwart multiple smuggling attempts of illegal cigarettes worth over Rs. 24 Mn
byline: Sri Lanka Customs in a major enforcement operation has seized a large quantity of foreign cigarettes smuggled into the country by several local passengers.

title: Saudi Arabia imposes temporary visa ban for 14 countries
byline: Saudi authorities have announced a temporary visa ban affecting 14 countries ahead of the Hajj season. The suspension applies to Umrah, business, and family visas, with restrictions expected to end by mid-June, according to diplomatic sources.

title: Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning.

title: Man allegedly attempted to open plane door on flight to Sydney
byline: A Jordanian national allegedly attempted to open the doors of a Sydney-bound plane on Saturday evening and had to be restrained by crew and other passengers, forcing the airline to request police assistance on arrival.

title: Leading liquor store owner booked for promoting booze sales through Facebook
byline: A leading liquor store chain owner cum hotelier had been booked by the Department of Excise yesterday for promoting booze sales through Facebook by using attractive discounts, thus violating the NATA Act. The Excise also took a large stock of foreign liquor kept in possession sans paying duty, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sri Lanka turns to India to stem fallout of U.S. tariffs
byline: In the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump slapping increased tariffs on imports, Sri Lanka sought to strengthen economic cooperation with India during the visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: NPP MP Kosala Nuwan passes away
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament (MP) Kosala Nuwan has passed away at the age of 38 after suffering a heart attack, hospital sources said.
